In this update, we have been working really hard to improve the usability of the e-mail application for you.

Improvements:

— Attached images are now opened in a higher resolution, depending on the device’s available memory.
— The application no longer displays an “Add to contacts” box in an e-mail message if the address is already listed in the phone book.
— In addition, this version contains fixes that will improve overall stability.

———

Having problems? Please contact us at mailapps@corp.mail.ru. We will do all we can to help restore harmony.

And if all is working as it should, please leave us a five-star rating. Every bit of positive feedback makes the world a better place and also makes our developers happier.

This version features several important changes that will make your work with the app even more convenient:

— When you reply to a message, long quoted text will collapse to free up space on the screen.
— Calendar invitations are now more visual and intuitive.
— We have streamlined the process of saving attached files to the device.
— This version also includes some fixes improving the stability of the app.

We’ve optimized the app for iOS 12 and added features: auto sign-in and saved passwords, grouped notifications, and simplified SMS sign-in (for two-factor authentication). And as always, this new version has fixes and improvements that make it even more stable.

New! New! New!
— Now you can switch between folders and the account menu by swiping. Swipe right or left to quickly move from one section to another.
— The app is now responsive: it responds to certain actions with a nice buzz.
— It’s easier to open the folder and account menu, because we made the touch area bigger. No more missed clicks!
— We updated the screen for adding accounts. See for yourself — it’s gorgeous.
— We made lots of subtle but pleasant design changes.
______

Say hello to the new version of Mail — with new improvements and fixes.

— We reworked synchronization of contacts: now they are correctly synchronized between the app and the web version of Mail.
— You can now select all text in the reading pane. Select a word. Then select "Select all" in the context menu that appears.
— Now you can insert fragments of HTML-formatted text and the app correctly recognizes them.
— We've added support for quiet notifications ("Delivery Quietly") in iOS 12.

New! New! New!
— Now you can switch between folders and the account menu by swiping. Swipe right or left to quickly move from one section to another.
— The app is now responsive: it responds to certain actions with a nice buzz.
— It’s easier to open the folder and account menu, because we made the touch area bigger. No more missed clicks!
— We updated the screen for adding accounts. See for yourself — it’s gorgeous.
— We made lots of subtle but pleasant design changes.

We are happy to present the new Mail, a super app for all your tasks! It has everything you need in one place.

Your meetings are organized in Calendar, todo lists in Tasks, while documents and email attachments are saved in Cloud, Videocalls will help you keep in touch with colleagues, and voice assistant Marusia will keep you entertained, answer your questions and read your messages for you.

To enable the new features, update the app, open it, go to “Account”, then “Appearance” and turn on “Quick access to services”.
